definition: ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy

pinyin: yu4 qi1 shou1 ru4 piao4 ju4

sentences.english: The official called the 1882 "Law of Bills."
The legal value of bill's abstraction is to protect holder's benefit.
sentences.chinese: 票据行为抽象性的法律价值在于保护持票人的利益。

sentences.english: Endoresment after date has been a difficult point in note theory.
sentences.chinese: 期后背书是票据法中的一个理论难点。

sentences.english: This check is printed on check protect paper .
sentences.chinese: 本票据印刷在支票专用纸上。

sentences.english: The built-in saw teeth makes it easy to tear the labels or bills.
sentences.chinese: 内建双用锯齿前挡装置，方便标签或票据的撕取。

sentences.english: In chapter two , i discuss western negotiable instrument market and rediscount policy.
sentences.chinese: 第二章，论述西方票据市场和再贴现政策。

sentences.english: Historically, the bank note is the overwhelmingly dominant form of warehouse receipt.
sentences.chinese: 在历史上，银行券是占绝对统治地位的票据形式。

sentences.english: You use the ticket-granting ticket to get the other tickets you need.
sentences.chinese: 你用票据授予票去得到你需要的其它票。

sentences.english: And, pulling out a drawer, Prudence showed me the papers.
sentences.chinese: 于是普律当丝打开一只抽屉给我看了这些票据。

sentences.english: The signature on a negotiable instrument shall be the true name of the party thereto.
sentences.chinese: 在票据上的签名，应当为该当事人的本名。

sentences.english: Of course, the label or ticket will also bear the magnifying glass.
sentences.chinese: 当然，标签或票据也具有放大镜的特性。

sentences.english: The intense reflection is stirred with the startup of medium-term notes(MTN).
sentences.chinese: 中期票据市场的启动在我国金融业引起强烈反响。

sentences.english: The bills came due, and we're still paying the price today.
sentences.chinese: 各种票据纷纷到期，迄今我们还在为此付出代价。

sentences.english: We should clean up the past-due bills.
sentences.chinese: 我们应该清理逾期票据。

sentences.english: Once again the assistant, gayne, began placing papers on the conference table .
sentences.chinese: 助手盖恩又一次把一些票据往会议桌上一摊。

sentences.english: On the Succession of Indorsement of Bill;
sentences.chinese: 目前针对票据背书的研究逐渐增多。

definition: to accept (i.e. acknowledge as calling for payment) (commerce)/to honor (a check, a promise)
